election_record.label: Ohio 1818 Governor

overview.note: The Official Certified Vote was Ethan A. Brown with 30174 votes and James Dunlap with 8075 votes.
The Official Certified Vote was Ethan A. Brown with 30174 votes even though the totals for the individual counties in the Official Certified Vote only added up to 30001 votes.

sub_unit.name: Ashtabula
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists Ethan A. Brown with 200 votes.

sub_unit.name: Belmont
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 1593 votes.

sub_unit.name: Champaign
sub_unit.note: The returns from Champaign County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Clark
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and The Miami Herald (Hamilton, OH) list James Dunlap with 238 votes.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 608 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clermont
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists James Dunlap with 241 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) and The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) list Ethan A. Brown with 532 votes and James Dunlap with 38 votes.

sub_unit.name: Columbiana
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists James Dunlap with 227 votes.

sub_unit.name: Coshocton
sub_unit.note: The Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH), The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH), The Miami Herald (Hamilton, OH), The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH), The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) list Ethan A. Brown with 656 votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) and The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) list James Dunlap with 130 votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists James Dunlap with 368 votes.

sub_unit.name: Geauga
sub_unit.note: The returns from Geauga County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Hamilton
sub_unit.note: The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH) and The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) list James Dunlap with 71 votes.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 2406 votes.

sub_unit.name: Harrison
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) do not list James Dunlap with any votes.

sub_unit.name: Jackson
sub_unit.note: The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH), The Miami Herald (Hamilton, OH), The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) and The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH) list James Dunlap with 266 votes.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH), the Western Herald and Steubenville Gazette (Steubenville, OH) and The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) do not list James Dunlap with any votes.

sub_unit.name: Knox
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Register (Canton) lists Ethan A. Brown with 422 votes, though the township totals it lists add up to 472 votes.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 534 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lawrence
sub_unit.note: No vote totals were recorded for Lawrence County.

sub_unit.name: Logan
sub_unit.note: The returns from Logan County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: One vote for Ethan A. Brown was listed as being for Ethan Brown.

sub_unit.name: Muskingum
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists Ethan A. Brown with 1449 votes because the votes from five townships were rejected.
The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 1530 votes.

sub_unit.name: Blue Rock
sub_unit.note: The votes from Blue Rock township were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Highland
sub_unit.note: The votes from Highland township were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Jackson
sub_unit.note: The votes from Jackson township were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Licking
sub_unit.note: The votes from Licking township were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Salem
sub_unit.note: The votes from Salem township were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Perry
sub_unit.note: The returns from Perry County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Clayton
sub_unit.note: For the election of Governor, the votes of Clayton township were included in Muskingum County.

sub_unit.name: Madison
sub_unit.note: For the election of Governor, the votes of Clayton township were included in Muskingum County.

sub_unit.name: Preble
sub_unit.note: No vote totals were recorded for Lawrence County.

sub_unit.name: Richland
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) list Ethan A. Brown with 636 votes and James Dunlap with 31 votes.

sub_unit.name: Ross
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists Ethan A. Brown with 611 votes and James Dunlap with 1042 votes, but those totals do not include the township of Concord.

sub_unit.name: Concord
sub_unit.note: "The election return from the township of Concord was rejected for want of the necessary form. We have attached the votes in that township."

sub_unit.name: Tuscarawas
sub_unit.note: The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) and The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH) list Ethan A. Brown with 502 votes.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The Miami Herald (Hamilton, OH) lists James Dunlap with 267 votes.
The Western Star lists James Dunlap with 297 votes.

election_record.reference: Abstract of Votes, Columbiana County. Western Reserve Historical Society, Cleveland.
Original Trumbull County Election Returns, unknown township.
Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH). October 20, 1818.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH). October 21, 1818.
The Western Reserve Chronicle (Warren, OH). October 22, 1818.
The Scioto Gazette, and Fredonian Chronicle (Chillicothe, OH). October 23, 1818.
Western Herald and Steubenville Gazette (Steubenville, OH). October 24, 1818.
Liberty Hall and Cincinnati Gazette (Cincinnati, OH). November 10, 1818.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH). November 18, 1818.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH). November 25, 1818.
The Ohio Register (Mount Vernon, OH). December 2, 1818.
Evans, Nelson W. A History of Scioto County, Ohio. Portsmouth, OH: Nelson W. Evans, 1903. 342.
Norton, A. Banning. A History of Knox County, Ohio, From 1779 to 1862 Inclusive. Columbus, OH: R. Nevins, 1862. 352.
